borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p>The scale and siting of proposed dwelling would result in a
loss of outlook and overbearing impact for neighbouring dwellings especially
nos.10 St Chad's Road and 110a and 110b High Road. As such, the proposed
development would have an unneighbourly impact and is deemed to be unacceptable. </p><ul><li>Part D of policy D6 of the London Plan (March
2021)</li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local
Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011)</li><li>Policy DMD1 of the London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December
2021)</li></ul>

<p>The shared bin and bike storage has failed to indicate the
quantum of bikes and refuse bins to be stored, failing to demonstrate that
there would be adequate space for it all and the manoeuvring of each bin or bike
in or out. Further the internal storage would not have any ventilation,
therefore this could pose problems relating to odours.·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</p><ul><li>Policy T5 and table 10.2 of London Plan (March
2021)</li><li>Policy BR11 of the the&nbsp;Local Development
Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011)</li><li>Policy DMT3 and Part 3 in policy DMSI 8 of the
London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19
Submission Version, December 2021)</li><li>Council's Planning Advice Note on Waste and
Recycling Provisions in New and Refurbished Residential Developments
(dated&nbsp;20/05/2021)</li></ul>

<p>The proposed development represents poor design, failing to
respect the architectural design of the surrounding area, lacks articulation
and interest and would not fit in with the character of the area, contrary to:·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><ul><li>
Paragraphs 126, 130 and 134 of the National
Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li>Policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (March
2021)</li><li>Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework
(LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policy BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development
Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011)</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD6 of the London Borough
of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p>The single aspect proposed dwelling presents a poor-quality unit
of accommodation, failing to demonstrate that the dwelling would experience good
passive ventilation and access to natural daylight. Further, the bedrooms would
be located on the ground floor with windows abutting the highway which would cause
a loss of privacy for the proposed occupants and no built-in storage private
external amenity space would be provided. As such the proposed development
would be unacceptable and contrary to:·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</p><ul><li>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (September 2023)</li><li>Policy D6 and Table 3.1 of the London Plan
(March 2021)</li><li>Policies BP5 and BP6 of the&nbsp;Local
Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011)</li><li>Part 6 of policy DMNE1 of the London Borough of
Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p>The proposed change of use from the rear of commercial unit
(Use Class E) to residential unit (Use Class&nbsp;C3) would result in the loss
of floorspace for a retail unit which sits within a neighbourhood centre, and
the development fails to demonstrate a need for this facility in this location,
the development is deemed to be unacceptable and contrary to:·&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</p><ul><li>Paragraph&nbsp;86 of the&nbsp;National Planning
Policy Framework&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li>Policies&nbsp;SD6, SD7 and&nbsp;E9&nbsp;of the
London Plan (March 2021)</li><li>Policies CM1 and CE1&nbsp;Local Development
Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li>Policies BE1 and BE2 of the&nbsp;Local
Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011)</li><li>Policies DME3 and DME5 of the London Borough of
Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
description: Change of use of rear of retail unit (Use Class E) to residential dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) and the construction of a two storey rear extension to provide a two bedroom dwelling at 110 High Road
